bio:treatment.discussion: This endemic species may resemble Buxbaumia aphylla. The sporangium however, is never glossy chestnut when mature, but is dull and greenish brown; the exostome is in 2–3 rows rather than one row as in B. aphylla.

references.reference: Ligrone, R. R. et al. 1982. Gametophyte and sporophyte ultrastructure in Buxbaumia piperi (Buxaumiaceae, Musci). J. Hattori Bot. Lab. 52: 465–499.
